sip_features.sip_feature:
HTML

RTL Updates:

HSDs:
1. 1204977900 , "(PCR) New VISA signals for SBR": The following new VISA signals are now exposed for fabric specs with PGCBENABLED=1. sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[4:0] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[5] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[6] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[7] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[8] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[9] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[11:10] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[12] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[13] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[19] sbcpwrgt.i_pgcbunit.i_pgcbfsm.pgcb_visa[20] Per-port cg_en and int_pok signals were also added for all configs.
2. 1204688654 , "(PCR) Gen2.1r6: SBR Pok Override capability": A new fabric spec parameter was created, POK_OVRD_EN. When set, this parameter enables the exposure of per-port POK-override pins at the top-level of the router (e.g., p0_pok_ovrd, …, pN_pok_ovrd, …, p15_pok_ovrd). The pN_pok_ovrd pin allows the SOC user to force the pok signal on port N to a value of 0, overriding the POK value assigned via the pN_pok input.
3. 1204688883 , "(PCR) Gen2.1: IOSF-SB- Provide a repeater flop module with SBR release": An SB repeater module is now included as a separate corekit in the SBR release, that could be directly instantiated on SOCs with long physical distances between routers. A collage builder script is available in the sbr_repeaters folder in the IRR drop, and usage details are documented in a README file in the sbr_repeaters directory.
4. 1404215572 , "(PCR) VCS2014.12 support for SVC, SBE and SBR": VCS 2014 was enabled for compile and tool runs.
5. 1404286748 , "IOSF Sideband Fabric Compiler migrating to new zircon rules 15.13.0": Migrating to zircon 15.13.0 from 14.47.0 for IPDS scoring.
6. 1404251920 , "Mix of blocking and non-blocking assignments XPROP error in RTR Arbiter": These were assertions (not RTL issues). But were changed to make XPROP clean.
7. 1206399338 , "functions in sbcfunc.vm has a coding style that potentially blocks x propagation": These were not real issues and there is a pending synopsis HSD for the XRPOP loop cases. But it’s fixed (rewritten) just to reduce customer complaints and to have a clean xprop report.

Backend Updates:

General Updates:

Validation Updates:

General Updates:

sip_speccons.sip_speccon:
HTML

Integration Notes:

NOTE: CTECH_LIB_NAME must point to a valid synthesisable CTECH library when synthesising the IP.

NOTE: CTECH_LIB_NAME must point to a valid synthesisable/behavior CTECH library when simulating the IP.

sip_specins.sip_specin:
HTML

This SBR release uses the "IOSF SVC ver 2015WW28_1" version of SVC in IRR

For support file an HSD at https://hsdes.intel.com/home/default.html#magazine?id=101846185&contentId=1012194360

The first endpoint release with support for parity pins is IOSF_Sideband_Endpoint_ALL_2014WW31_R1p0_v5.

The Zircon scores are uploaded to the IPDS dashboard for the SBR IP at https://zircon.fm.intel.com/zircon/zircon/zirconReleaseDashboardTable.php?top_filter_checkbox=0&Proj_id=12686&IP_id=17319&milestone_filter=4&Ver_id=all&App_id=all&showlatest=0
